description: A software intermediary that allows two applications to talk to each other.
A mathmatical notation used to classify algorithms based on their run time & space requirements and their relationship to input size.
A computer programming technique whereby a procedure, subroutine, function, or algorithm calls itself one or more times until a specified condition is met.
A project management methodology focused on the iterative development process, where feedback is continuously gathered from users and stakeholders to create the best user experience.
A programmer who is skilled in both back-end and front-end tools and technologies.
A hardware or software component that stores data so that future requests for that data are served faster.
An application that enables users to collaborately create, edit, publish, and store digital content.
Text files with small data are placed on your browser by a web server to identify your computer.
Where the latest versions of software are pushed live to intended users. And, this is where dreams are made.
The tools and practices used to keep many versions of a software system configured and organized.
The communicatoin protocl used to connect to web servers on the internet or local network.
A product with enough features to attract early-adopter customers to validate a product idea.
When a project's requirements changes and work starts to extend beyond what was originally planned.
A security protocol that creates an encrypted link between a web server and a browser.
A programming model where operations take place in non-sequential fashion.
A programming paradigm where programs are constructued by applying and composing (primarily) pure functions.
A programming paradigm that organizes software around data, or objects, rather than functions and logic.
A text-based prompter which connects a user to a computer program or operating system.
A computer program that translates source code written in one language into another target language (usually machine code).
A structured storage space where data is held and easily accessible.
A software application for building software applications that combines common developer tools into a single GUI.
A programming technique that allows programmers to create classes that are build upon existing classes.
A programming technique that allows programmers to create a model that is associated with multiple objects or classes.
An open standard file and data interchange format that is both human and machine readable/friendly.
A built-in HTML API that defines the document's logical structure in object format for easily creating or manipulating elements.
A software architecture style for building scalable web services typically using HTTP & JSON.
The process of enhancing the quality and quantity of website traffic to a website via search engines.
A key component every project should implement that improves the ability for disabled or impaired users to interact with your app or website.
UI refers to the aesthetic elements that users interact with, while UX denotes a user's experience with the product or service.
A programming expression or command that instructs a computer to run code if a specified statement is truthy or not.
Variables without a value are globally 'Undefined' but can be explicitly set to show this using 'Null'.
the use of HTML markup to reinforce the meaning of the information in webpages to both programmers and robots.
An expression is code that may be evaluated to determine it's value primarily via operators such as '+', '>' or '==='.
A process in programming wherein a set of instructions or structures are repeated in a sequence for a number of times until a condition is met.
A website or application can either be rendered on the server (SSR) or by the clients browser (CSR).
A property of some operations such that no matter how many times you execute them, you achieve the same result.
An optimization technique used primarily to speed up computer programs by storing the results of expensive function calls and returning the cached result when the same inputs are given.
A technique for arranging complexity of computer systems by hidding away functionality when the implementation is not essential to know.
A procedure or formula for solving a problem, based on conducting a sequence of specified actions.
A specialized format for organizing, processing, retrieving, and storing data.
An approach to front-end development wherein you design and code the mobile site first before implementing the desktop version.
A design approach used to create content that adjusts smoothly to various screen sizes and devises.
A diagrammatic representation of a website used to plan the organization of pages to improve project clarity and user experience.
A two-dimensional skeletal outline of a webpage or application.
The spacing between individual letters or characters.
The space between multiple lines of type, measured from baseline to baseline.
The typographer's term for letter-spacing over a range of characters.
An instruction to the audience to provoke an immediate response, usually to take some sort of desired action.
A randomized experimentation process wherein two or more versions of a variable are changed and compared to see which performs better for a specific desired outcome.
A specific set of syntax used to write computer programs.
A collection of prewritten code programmers can implement and use in a top-down manner.
A prepackaged set of solutions that solves common development problems from the foundation upward.
Standard markup language for documents designed to be displayed in a web browser.
A style sheet language used for describing the presentation of a document written in a markup language such as HTML.
A dynamic programming language used for web development, software applications, game creation, and more.
A free and open-source JavaScript library for building user interfaces based on UI components.
A platform and JavaScript framework for building single-page client applications using HTML & Typescript.
A free and open-source relational database management system emphasizing extensibility and SQL compliance.
An open-source NoSQL database management program useful for working with large sets of distributed data.
An open-source development platform for executing JavaScript code on the server-side.
A classification that specifies which type of value a variable has and what type of mathematical, relational, or logical operations can be applied to it without causing an error.
